title: Workshop on Developing Self-Regulated Learning Strategies for Social Problem Solving (K-12)

context.prior_knowledge: Basic social studies knowledge and competency in digital learning tools
context.additional_context: Conducted in a smartphone-based microlearning environment, implementing a blended project combining problem-based learning (PBL) and project-based learning (PjBL)

learning_goals: Learners can apply advanced thinking strategies (deepening, critical thinking, metacognition) at 80%+ frequency in PjBL environments to solve complex social issues
Learners evaluate and improve project progress three or more times using self-regulated learning tools (checklists, planners) via mobile devices alone
Learners perceive instructor autonomy support at 4/5 or higher on a Likert scale in PBL/PjBL environments, enhancing self-directed decision-making capabilities

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
